title: Discussion Panel: Maximising Innovation Potential Through Diversity in Research Organisations

author: Judith Abrahami, ORT Braude College of Engineering

segmentation: As you probably saw from your list from the program, we have different continents.
We have different countries represented here, and so we're going to hear about really different situations and different project and therefore what I want to.

Suggest that since the presentations that we are about to hear really describe work done in different parts of the world, we as we listen to them, we think all the time about the diverse cultural settings that created these activities.
These actions and these good practices.
I'm a sociologist.
I'm concerned with the cultural differences and of course we cannot assume that what works in one place can be carried on to the next place with no.
Change and therefore I suggest as we listen to these talks, we bear in mind that programs and interventions always need to be tailor made.
What suits one country doesn't suit the other.
Replication is never a viable option.
We always need adaptation and variations.
And I say this also in connection with all the good practices that appear on their gendera website.
Now 64 good practices and one thing that the partners injured area we always discussed.
Is that the practices are different because the circumstances are different and we have to bear that in mind and you'll find a lot about that on the Gendera website.
Women's lives vary from place to place, so of course the conditions are different and anything you hear about you have to think of how it would work in your country.
I'm not going to elaborate on these issues, but I'm sure that these most people here are aware of the fact that there are many variables that might influence gender issues.
Various issues, I mean in the different countries, in the different cultures.
And so again, when listening, I think it's worthwhile thinking what country each of these stories comes from and what might work in your country.
Considering some of these social factors that definitely make a difference to the lives of women.
Here are some more issues that you might consider when thinking of what could work for you.
What couldn't work for you.
Grassroots organizations, religion, living conditions life is different.
We heard before a very important talk about UNESCO and its awareness of difference in various countries.
So we have various countries here.
Yes, we have the use a we have Germany.
We have Turkey.
I'm from Israel that but I'm not going to talk about the situation there in this in this talk.
But life is different in all these different places.
Now I'm very sorry to see that the speaker who was here before the gentleman Speaker isn't here now becausw.
If we talk about cultural differences, we need to raise our awareness to cultural differences.
And so I was wondering about hidden messages and walking around stood guard yesterday, very briefly, I came across this.
Which is what you saw before.
Now look at the question I vote.
Look at the bottom line.
Do men objected this sign?
So I was very excited to see a man objecting to this sign, so I'm sorry he's not here now to see it.
And as I looked and took this photograph yesterday in the Gray with the grey Sky, I was really wondering.
Weather local people are sensitive to it, whether they are aware of it, because I think it was very often happens we are so a customized to are not the norms.
Wherever we come from that we are not aware of the messages that are really being transferred.
Now this is a slide that he showed.
I'm very glad to show that I have another slide which he didn't show.
What about this?
I mean, there's where she can be an.
What are the one to do when she realized she is out of a permitted zone?
So I'm very sorry he's not not that I want to sort of this one up Manship, because I'm a woman, but I thought this was also an interesting point.
That is not the zone of woman.
Why?
Because that's where cars are, where action is, where it's less safe.
I think it says a lot about about what happens really to two women.

So if I think of these two images and I'm not going to go into it at length, the point I'm trying to make is that we must learn to turn the familiar into the strange, by which I mean we're all used to seeing certain things we're so used to seeing things that we think that that's the only way things can be run.

That's the natural way, as so many people like saying, and therefore, even though things are familiar, we must estrange ourselves like myself, coming as a tourist and bang, seeing it and saying, well, I must get it into my presentation.
I wonder if other people who pass it every day think about it.
That's what I mean by turning the familiar into the strange.
Never underestimate the power of hidden messages.
You might say it doesn't matter, it matters very much.
And firstly, I can tell you I made a whole doctors on hidden messages, so sometimes it can make a difference and the last point which is also connected.
I said I called it no Norm should be considered normal because it's so much of the discussion of gender roles and women's careers.
People are told, well, this is normal, that the family goes after the husband that the woman is at home.
We saw interesting discussion before and so all this that is considered normal.
I would say that's the norm.
It doesn't mean.
That we need to accept it.

Since I had an image from the street I introduced now another two images and I suggest that we change our images of women and men's academic lives, and I'm interested images 'cause as I said, I'm interested in hidden messages and let's see how it works.
I found this.
I give credit to the illustrator.
I found these two descriptions.
The top is the male academic career.
At the bottom is a womans females academic career.
I hope it's clear enough to see and I think the moment you see where's my laser?
The moment you see baby, you know something is going to change.
Notice that that the Mr doesn't even have the baby there because the man can have the baby without it affecting his lifestyle.
So so often, and if we go on.

These symbols I'm glad to say that there's another suggestion, a corrective image that means you still have the babies, but you have help and assistance as you move on, and therefore this can help a woman reach a higher position.
You will be able to see this on the website.
I'm suggesting this because sometimes we even look for images and in my work I often use images to make us think of what happens to raise discussion.
So here it is.
